meanings.definition: Having a harsh or grating sound
meanings.sent1: The raspish noise of the old door hinges made me cover my ears.
meanings.sent2: The raspish sound of the chalk scratching the blackboard was unbearable.
meanings.sent3: The raspish squeak of the mouse made the cat jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The raspish wind howled through the trees, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The raspish screech of the brakes echoed through the empty street.

meanings.definition: Resembling a rasp in sound or quality
meanings.sent1: The raspish voice of the singer reminded me of nails on a chalkboard.
meanings.sent2: The raspish texture of the sandpaper felt rough against my skin.
meanings.sent3: The raspish laughter of the hyenas filled the night with an unsettling tone.
meanings.sent4: The raspish feedback from the microphone startled the audience.
meanings.sent5: The raspish taste of the unripe apple made me pucker my lips.

meanings.sent1: His raspish attitude towards criticism often led to arguments.
meanings.sent2: She became raspish whenever someone interrupted her work.
meanings.sent3: The raspish customer complained about every little detail of the meal.
meanings.sent4: The raspish cat hissed at anyone who came too close to its food.
meanings.sent5: His raspish behavior made it difficult for others to approach him.
